newsitem.title: ISRAEL: ECI Telecom gets new orders.
newsitem.headline: ECI Telecom gets new orders.

text.p: Israel's ECI Telecom Ltd said on Thursday its wholly owned subsidiary Telematics Inc has received two new orders for its network access server product, Nevada.
Company officials declined to reveal the value of the orders.
The Nevada systems have been shipped to service providers in Italy and Portugal. The systems have already been deployed in the United Kingom, Germany and the Asia-Pacific region.
The new orders mean that Telematics has now moved from the phase of field trials to the stage of deliveries, the company said.

Nevada is a multiservice platform providing Internet and Intranet access. It also works with existing corporate packet switching systems such X.25. The Nevada supports up to five connections that service up to 120 analog and digital simultaneous calls.
